lab.util

Class CollectionElementsBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • lab.util.CollectionElementsBuilder

  • public class CollectionElementsBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    Auxiliary class that contains static methods for parse Location and Item objects from xml and json format or pack them to xml format.
    Since:
    1.5.0

      • CollectionElementsBuilder

    • Method Detail

      • fromFile

        public static boolean fromFile(java.lang.String filePath,
                               java.util.Collection<Location> collection)
        Adds to the collection new elements which program constructs from data from XML file.
        Method skips elements that don't have only two tags (locationName and items array)
        Method skips items that have unknown or unsupported name of class, invalid form of attributes representation or values of attributes that can't be cast to necessary type. Also it skips items that don't have only two tags (class and attributes array)
        Method counts added elements, missed elements and items and shows information in the end of invoking.
        Parameters:
        filePath - way to file with XML code from which program takes data for update collection
        Returns:
        true if program found file and its XML code is valid else return false

      • collectionToXML

        public static java.lang.String collectionToXML(java.util.Collection<Location> collection)
        Creates from elements of collection XML code.
        Returns:
        XML code of serialized collection like a String

      • parseJsonElement

        public static Location parseJsonElement(java.lang.String jsonElement)
        Method receives data in json format for creating new element, creates it and returns.
        Method skips items that have unknown or unsupported name of class, invalid form of attributes representation or values of attributes that can't be cast to necessary type
        Parameters:
        jsonElement - Argument of command that is valid json code for creating new element
        Returns:
        location if data in json format contains array of items and json code is valid and correct else return null

      • constructItem

        public static Item constructItem(java.lang.String className,
                                 java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> fields)
                          throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                 java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Method receives class name and HashMap (its keys are fields name and its values are values of these fields) and find necessary method to create new item.
        Search takes place thanks to reflection, program find method with name: "create" + className.
        Parameters:
        className - Name of class which needs to create
        fields - HashMap (its keys are fields name and its values are values of these fields) that contains attributes for creating new item
        Returns:
        new item
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - It takes place if className param is unknown or unsupported class name
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - For supported class this exception never throws, but it can be throwed when trying to invoke outside method that don't relate to creating items
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - It throws when values of attributes of item has type that can't be cast to necessary type (For example, expect Number, recieved String with letters)

      • createRock

        public static Rock createRock(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> fields)
        Receives attributes contained in HashMap and create new Rock
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        new Rock object
